In 2006 a man named Mathias hired me for the second time, I moved from Leyton E10 to South Woodford E18, I turned 32 and my band Little Monkeys released a live album on 6th June (6/6/6).

Twitter was launched, NASA successfully obtained dust from a comet, Pluto lost its status as a planet, Ban Ki-moon became head of the UN and Paul McCartney - writer of the song â€œWhen Iâ€™m 64â€ - turned 64.

The roll-call for the dead included Wilson Pickett, Linda Smith, Gene Pitney, Syd Barrett, David Gemmell, Steve Irwin, Alan â€œFluffâ€ Freeman, Charlie Drake, Saddam Hussein and Nice Guy Eddie (Chris Penn).

And there was some music.

Honourable mentions

Buckcherry - 15

Buckcherry went and vanished for a while after their epic 2001 release Time Bomb but when they did show up again five years later, this is what they had for us, and itâ€™s a beauty. Top track: â€œEverythingâ€

DragonForce - Inhuman Rampage

Like many people my first encounter with DragonForce was at the end of Guitar Hero III on the Xbox. It intrigued me enough to get the album and I loved it immediately. What I love about their music is that itâ€™s honest - itâ€™s shreddy speed metal with a sense of humour and itâ€™s not trying to be anything else. Fun. Fun fact: Iâ€™ve jammed with Herman Li of DragonForce a couple of times. Heâ€™s terrifying. :-) Top track: â€œThrough the Fire and Flamesâ€

Guthrie Govan - Erotic Cakes

Iâ€™ve been playing guitar for over two decades. When people used to ask me â€œAlright, so whoâ€™s the best guitarist in the world, then?â€ I used to have to say things like â€œWell, itâ€™s not like that, there are great shredders and real virtuosos, and then youâ€™ve got amazing band players like Slash and Page, and songwriters like Knopfler andâ€¦â€ but thatâ€™s all gone now. Now I just say â€œEasy, itâ€™s Guthrie Govan. Next?â€ Top track: â€œFivesâ€

The Killers - Samâ€™s Town

I used to hate The Killers. It wasnâ€™t helped by designers at the ad agency I joined in 2006 playing this album over and over on the office stereo. But over time it grew on me, and I realised that â€œThe Best British Band to Come Out Of Las Vegasâ€ had produced a classic. Top track: â€œWhen You Were Youngâ€

Muse - Black Holes & Revelations

Matt Bellamy is an utterly astonishing musician and Muse just keep knocking out brilliant album after brilliant album. Top track: â€œKnights of Cydoniaâ€

And the winner isâ€¦

My Chemical Romance - The Black Parade

See previous re MCR being emo. Whether they were or werenâ€™t, I honestly couldnâ€™t care less, as underneath there was a damned excellent hard rock band. Iâ€™ve checked out their first two albums and the quality isnâ€™t quite there to be honest, but this - their third studio album - is utterly flawless from start to finish.

So come one - come all - to this tragic affair, and make sure you play it loud.

Top tracks: â€œThis Is How I Disappearâ€, â€œWelcome to the Black Paradeâ€, â€œThe Sharpest Livesâ€

Turkey of the Year

New feature! If there was really an album that stuck out to me as being a low moment of the year, I shall record it so that others might not make the same mistakes I did.

Joe Satriani - Super Colossal

This was the last Satriani album I bought, though heâ€™s released several more since. I just couldnâ€™t keep doing it. I couldnâ€™t keep going back to the same well and drinking the same dull sugary water any longer. Heâ€™s still an incredible musician, but this was a bridge too far. Too many predictable ballads, too many mid-tempo groovers that go on for 4? 7? 10? minutes or basically until you rip the CD out and put something fun on. If you want to listen to some cracking Satch, stick on Crystal Planet and avoid this at all costs.
